article: Sunshine on a Rainy Day   Have you ever had a day when everything seemed to go wrong, and nothing seemed to go right? Not too long ago I was having one of those _ . I was discouraged, tired, and sad. My focus was on me, me, me, after all, no one else was experiencing the same sufferings _ I was.   I _ my sad state to my mother, hoping for some pity. Instead , she said , "I heard Jamie was having a(n) _ day, too. Why don't you make her some cookies and we'll _ them to her this afternoon?" I didn't really want to, _ decided that I didn't want to go back to my other problems just yet. I _ the cookies and arranged them on a little plate. Then I made a card with a sunflower on it and wrote a small note of _ words.   That afternoon we dropped by my friend's house. I went to the door and _ the bell. Soon, Jamie came to the door and looked at me in surprise for the unexpected visit. Before she could say anything I rushed, "I _ you were having a hard day and decided to bring you _ .I hope your day goes better." The look that came over Jamie' face was _ that I could never put into words. It was 51 as if a darkened sky was suddenly lit with the golden rays of the sun; it was as if in that small act, her day was _ .   I got back into the car and for some _ reason, I felt a lot better myself. That day I experienced the _ Jamie Barrie attempted to describe."Those who bring sunshine to the lives of others, cannot keep it off from themselves."
